paragraphs: I am a software engineer transitioning from a career as a mechanical engineer.

My formal education is in mechanical engineering but coding is not new to me. I learned the fundamentals of programming as an undergrad and used code extensively during my college and professional career to solve engineering problems. I also learned to program microcontrollers for use in robotics and motor control.

During my time as a mechanical engineer at the startup company Dronesmith Technologies I was enlisted to help with software development and testing. The companyâ€™s main product was an API that allowed users to control drones with HTTP requests. I wrote Python scripts to test this API and created tutorials on using the API. I also assisted the senior software engineer by adding login functionality to an API dashboard that had a Angular.js/Bootstrap frontend and a Node.js/Express backend. This introduction to full stack web development gave me an understanding of the communication between the back-end and front-end of web applications and how to work with Javascript and CSS frameworks.
